custom_item_1.info:
The device info should be reviewed.

  NOTE: Nessus has provided the target output to assist in reviewing the benchmark to ensure target compliance.
custom_item_1.solution: In the Web UI , navigate to the 'System' section , click on 'Information' and then fill out the appropriate form fields.

custom_item_2.info: Ensuring that approved NTP servers are used allows for accurate log/audit file correlation.
custom_item_2.solution: In the Web UI , navigate to the 'System' section , click on 'NTP' and then click the check box for 'Enable NTP'.

custom_item_3.info: Ensuring that approved NTP servers are used allows for accurate log/audit file correlation.
custom_item_3.solution: In the Web UI , navigate to the 'System' section , click on 'NTP' and then click the check box for 'Enable NTP'. Add applicable server IP addresses.

custom_item_4.info: The DNS server IP address should be reviewed. A DNS server may return malicious IP addresses in response to requests for domains that are normally good. This provides an avenue to leak information about the appliance or to download untrusted content.
custom_item_4.solution: In the Web UI , navigate to the 'Network' section , click on 'Interfaces' and populate the DNS server text box with a DNS server IP and then click 'Add'.

custom_item_5.info: The WINS server IP address should be reviewed. A WINS server may return malicious IP addresses in response to requests for NetBIOS names that are normally good. This provides an avenue to leak information about the appliance or to download untrusted content.
custom_item_5.solution: In the Web UI , navigate to the 'Network' section , click on 'Interfaces' and populate the WINS server text box with a WINS server IP and then click 'Add'.

custom_item_7.info: Ensure LDAP server is trusted - LDAP Server Name
custom_item_7.solution: In the Web UI navigate to the 'Authentications' - > 'Servers' -> 'LDAP' section and populate the appropriate text fields.

custom_item_8.info: Ensure LDAP server is trusted - LDAP Server Password is used
custom_item_8.solution: In the Web UI navigate to the 'Authentications' - > 'Servers' -> 'LDAP' section and populate the appropriate text fields.

custom_item_9.info: Ensure LDAP server is trusted - LDAP Server Port
custom_item_9.solution: In the Web UI navigate to the 'Authentications' - > 'Servers' -> 'LDAP' section and populate the appropriate text fields.

custom_item_10.description: WatchGuard : DoS Prevention - Drop SYN Flood Attack
custom_item_10.info: DoS Prevention - Drop SYN Flood Attack
custom_item_10.solution: In the Web UI navigate to the 'Firewall' - > 'Default Packet Handling' section. Click the checkbox next to 'Drop SYN Flood Attack'.

custom_item_11.description: WatchGuard : DoS Prevention - Drop ICMP Flood Attack
custom_item_11.info: DoS Prevention - Drop ICMP Flood Attack
custom_item_11.solution: In the Web UI navigate to the 'Firewall' - > 'Default Packet Handling' section. Click the checkbox next to 'Drop ICMP Flood Attack'.

custom_item_12.description: WatchGuard : DoS Prevention - Drop UDP Flood Attack
custom_item_12.info: DoS Prevention - Drop UDP Flood Attack
custom_item_12.solution: In the Web UI navigate to the 'Firewall' - > 'Default Packet Handling' section. Click the checkbox next to 'Drop UDP Flood Attack'.

custom_item_13.description: WatchGuard : DoS Prevention - Drop IP Source Route
custom_item_13.info: DoS Prevention - Drop IP Source Route
custom_item_13.solution: In the Web UI navigate to the 'Firewall' - > 'Default Packet Handling' section. Click the checkbox next to 'Drop IP Source Route'.

custom_item_14.description: WatchGuard : DoS Prevention - Drop IPSEC Flood Attack
custom_item_14.info: DoS Prevention - Drop IPSEC Flood Attack
custom_item_14.solution: In the Web UI navigate to the 'Firewall' - > 'Default Packet Handling' section. Click the checkbox next to 'Drop IPSEC Flood Attack'.

custom_item_15.description: WatchGuard : DoS Prevention - Drop IKE Flood Attack
custom_item_15.info: DoS Prevention - Drop IKE Flood Attack
custom_item_15.solution: In the Web UI navigate to the 'Firewall' - > 'Default Packet Handling' section. Click the checkbox next to 'Drop IKE Flood Attack'.

custom_item_16.description: WatchGuard : DoS Prevention - Block Address Space Probes
custom_item_16.info: DoS Prevention - Block Address Space Probes
custom_item_16.solution: In the Web UI navigate to the 'Firewall' - > 'Default Packet Handling' section. Click the checkbox next to 'Block Address Space Probes'.

custom_item_17.description: WatchGuard : DoS Prevention - Block Port Space Probes
custom_item_17.info: DoS Prevention - Block Port Space Probes
custom_item_17.solution: In the Web UI navigate to the 'Firewall' - > 'Default Packet Handling' section. Click the checkbox next to 'Block Port Space Probes'.

custom_item_18.description: WatchGuard : DDoS Prevention - Distributed Denial-of-Service Prevention - Per Server Quota
custom_item_18.info: DDoS Prevention - Distributed Denial-of-Service Prevention - Per Server Quota
custom_item_18.solution: In the Web UI navigate to the 'Firewall' - > 'Default Packet Handling' section. Populate the test field next to 'Per Server Quota'.
custom_item_18.regex: Distributed Denial-of-Service Prevention - Per Server Quota:
custom_item_18.expect: Distributed Denial-of-Service Prevention - Per Server Quota: @DDOS_PER_SERV@

custom_item_19.description: WatchGuard : DDoS Prevention - Distributed Denial-of-Service Prevention - Per Client Quota
custom_item_19.info: Distributed Denial-of-Service Prevention - Per Client Quota
custom_item_19.solution: In the Web UI navigate to the 'Firewall' - > 'Default Packet Handling' section. Populate the test field next to 'Per Client Quota'.
custom_item_19.regex: Distributed Denial-of-Service Prevention - Per Client Quota:
custom_item_19.expect: Distributed Denial-of-Service Prevention - Per Client Quota: @DDOS_PER_CLIENT@

custom_item_20.info: ICMP Error messages can be used as a means to compromise sytems and networks. Appropriate configuration and filtering of these messages should be used to reduce potential threats.
custom_item_20.solution: In the Web UI navigate to the 'System' - > 'Global Settings' - > 'Networking' section. Uncheck the box for 'Fragmentation req (PMTU)'.

custom_item_21.info: ICMP Error messages can be used as a means to compromise sytems and networks. Appropriate configuration and filtering of these messages should be used to reduce potential threats.
custom_item_21.solution: In the Web UI navigate to the 'System' - > 'Global Settings' - > 'Networking' section. Uncheck the box for 'Time Exceeded'.

custom_item_22.info: ICMP Error messages can be used as a means to compromise sytems and networks. Appropriate configuration and filtering of these messages should be used to reduce potential threats.
custom_item_22.solution: In the Web UI navigate to the 'System' - > 'Global Settings' - > 'Networking' section. Uncheck the box for 'Network unreachable'.

custom_item_23.info: ICMP Error messages can be used as a means to compromise sytems and networks. Appropriate configuration and filtering of these messages should be used to reduce potential threats.
custom_item_23.solution: In the Web UI navigate to the 'System' - > 'Global Settings' - > 'Networking' section. Uncheck the box for 'Host unreachable'.

custom_item_24.info: ICMP Error messages can be used as a means to compromise sytems and networks. Appropriate configuration and filtering of these messages should be used to reduce potential threats.
custom_item_24.solution: In the Web UI navigate to the 'System' - > 'Global Settings' - > 'Networking' section. Uncheck the box for 'Port unreachable'.

custom_item_25.info: ICMP Error messages can be used as a means to compromise sytems and networks. Appropriate configuration and filtering of these messages should be used to reduce potential threats.
custom_item_25.solution: In the Web UI navigate to the 'System' - > 'Global Settings' - > 'Networking' section. Uncheck the box for 'Protocol unreachable'.

custom_item_26.solution: In the Web UI , navigate to the 'System' section , click on 'SNMP' and then click the dropdown box for 'Version'. Set it to 'v3'.

custom_item_27.description: WatchGuard : SNMP Configuration - v3 uses SHA1 Auth Algorithm
custom_item_27.info: If SNMP v3 users are configured, they should use SHA1 for authentication.
custom_item_27.solution: In the Web UI , navigate to the 'System' section , click on 'SNMP' and then click the dropdown box for 'Authentication Protocol'. Set it to 'SHA1'.

custom_item_28.description: WatchGuard : SNMP Configuration - v3 uses DES
custom_item_28.info: If SNMP v3 is used, it should use DES for privacy.
custom_item_28.solution: In the Web UI , navigate to the 'System' section , click on 'SNMP' and then click the dropdown box for 'Privacy Protocol'. Set it to 'DES'.

custom_item_29.description: WatchGuard : SNMP Configuration - v3 user has password - auth protocol
custom_item_29.info: SNMP Configuration - v3 users have passwords
custom_item_29.solution: In the Web UI , navigate to the 'System' section , click on 'SNMP' and then click the password form box for 'Password' under authentication protocol. Fill out the form with the password.

custom_item_30.description: WatchGuard : SNMP Configuration - v3 user has password - priv protocol
custom_item_30.info: SNMP Configuration - v3 users have passwords
custom_item_30.solution: In the Web UI , navigate to the 'System' section , click on 'SNMP' and then click the password form box for 'Password' under authentication protocol. Fill out the form with the password.

custom_item_31.info: Ensure SNMP does not use an easy to guess or default community string - 'private'
custom_item_31.solution: In the Web UI , navigate to the 'System' section , click on 'SNMP' and then click the community string form box. Ensure that the community string is not 'private'.

custom_item_32.info: Ensure SNMP does not use an easy to guess or default community string - 'public'.
custom_item_32.solution: In the Web UI , navigate to the 'System' section , click on 'SNMP' and then click the community string form box. Ensure that the community string is not 'public'.

custom_item_33.info: Verify the device is configured to submit system logs to one or more syslog servers to centrally record system events.
custom_item_33.solution: In the Web UI , navigate to the 'System' section , click on 'Logging' and then click the 'Send log messages to the syslog server at this IP address' check box.

custom_item_34.info: Ensuring that Syslog Timestamps are used allows for accurate log/audit file correlation.
custom_item_34.solution: In the Web UI , navigate to the 'System' section , click on 'Logging' and then click the 'The time stamp' checkbox under the 'Select the details to include in syslog messages' check box.

custom_item_35.description: WatchGuard : Logging - Configuration Changes are Logged
custom_item_35.info: Verify that Configuration Changes are Logged.
custom_item_35.solution: In the Web UI , navigate to the 'System' section , click on 'Logging' and then click the 'Send log messages when the configuration for this Firebox is changed' checkbox under the 'Settings' section.

custom_item_36.solution: In the Web UI , navigate to the 'System' section , click on 'Logging' and then click the 'Enable IKE packet tracing to Firebox internal storage' checkbox under the 'Settings' section.

custom_item_37.description: WatchGuard : Logging - Review Remote Logging Server Address
custom_item_37.info: Verify the device is configured to submit system logs to one or more syslog servers to centrally record system events.
custom_item_37.solution: In the Web UI , navigate to the 'System' section , click on 'Logging' and then review the syslog IP address

custom_item_38.info: Set a timeout to avoid the possibility of an user walking away from the management computer and leaving it exposed to unauthorized personnel - 'Authentication User Timeout'
custom_item_38.solution: In the Web UI , navigate to the 'Authentication' section , click on 'settings' and then fill out the 'idle Timeout' form field under the 'Firewall Authentication' section.

custom_item_39.description: WatchGuard : Authentication Settings - 'Authentication User Session Timeout'
custom_item_39.info: Set a timeout to avoid the possibility of an user walking away from the management computer and leaving it exposed to unauthorized personnel - 'Authentication User Session Timeout'
custom_item_39.solution: In the Web UI , navigate to the 'Authentication' section , click on 'settings' and then fill out the 'Session Timeout' form field under the 'Firewall Authentication' section.

custom_item_40.description: WatchGuard : Authentication Settings - 'Management User Idle Timeout'
custom_item_40.info: Set a timeout to avoid the possibility of an user walking away from the management computer and leaving it exposed to unauthorized personnel - 'Management User Idle Timeout'
custom_item_40.solution: In the Web UI , navigate to the 'Authentication' section , click on 'settings' and then fill out the 'Idle Timeout' form field under the 'Management Session' section.

custom_item_41.description: WatchGuard : Authentication Settings - 'Management User Session Timeout'
custom_item_41.info: Set a timeout to avoid the possibility of an user walking away from the management computer and leaving it exposed to unauthorized personnel - 'Management User Session Timeout'
custom_item_41.solution: In the Web UI , navigate to the 'Authentication' section , click on 'settings' and then fill out the 'Session Timeout' form field under the 'Management Session' section.

custom_item_42.info: When used properly, SSO can increase security by allowing for the use of more complex authentication policies. Single-Sign On - 'Enabled'
custom_item_42.solution: In the Web UI , navigate to the 'Authentication' section , click on 'Single Sign-On' and then check the 'Enable Single Sign-On (SSO) with Active Directory' checkbox.

custom_item_43.solution: In the Web UI , navigate to the 'Subscription Services' section , click on 'IPS' and then click the check box for 'Enable Intrusion Prevention'.

custom_item_44.info: Verify the device is configured to keep IDS signatures up to date.
custom_item_44.solution: In the Web UI , navigate to the 'Subscription Services' section , click on 'IPS', click the 'Update Server' tab and then click the check box for 'Enable automatic update'.

custom_item_45.info: Verify the device is configured to keep GAV signatures up to date.
custom_item_45.solution: In the Web UI , navigate to the 'Subscription Services' section , click on 'Gateway AntiVirus', click the 'Settings' button and then click the check box for 'Enable automatic update'.

custom_item_46.description: WatchGuard : Data Loss Prevention Signature Update - 'Enabled'
custom_item_46.info: Verify the device is configured to keep DLP signatures up to date.
custom_item_46.solution: In the Web UI , navigate to the 'Subscription Services' section , click on 'Data Loss Prevention', click the 'Settings' button and then click the check box for 'Enable automatic update'.

custom_item_47.info:
Review ABS Policy Listing

  NOTE: Nessus has provided the target output to assist in reviewing the benchmark to ensure target compliance.

custom_item_48.description: WatchGuard : IPS Logging Threat Level Critical - Enabled
custom_item_48.info: Verify IPS items classified as threat level 'critical' are logged.
custom_item_48.solution: In the Web UI , navigate to the 'Subscription Services' section , click on 'IPS', click the 'Settings' button and then click the check box for Threat level 'Critical' -> 'Log'.

custom_item_49.description: WatchGuard : IPS Logging Threat Level HIGH - Enabled
custom_item_49.info: Verify IPS items classified as threat level 'high' are logged.
custom_item_49.solution: In the Web UI , navigate to the 'Subscription Services' section , click on 'IPS', click the 'Settings' button and then click the check box for Threat level 'High' -> 'Log'.

custom_item_50.description: WatchGuard : IPS Logging Threat Level Medium - Enabled
custom_item_50.info: Verify IPS items classified as threat level 'medium' are logged.
custom_item_50.solution: In the Web UI , navigate to the 'Subscription Services' section , click on 'IPS', click the 'Settings' button and then click the check box for Threat level 'Medium' -> 'Log'.

custom_item_51.description: WatchGuard : IPS Threat Level Action Critical - DROP or BLOCK
custom_item_51.info: Verify IPS items classified as threat level 'critical' are set to DROP or BLOCK.
custom_item_51.solution: In the Web UI , navigate to the 'Subscription Services' section , click on 'IPS', click the 'Settings' button and then click the drop down box for Threat level 'Critical' -> 'Action' to 'Drop' or 'Block'.

custom_item_52.description: WatchGuard : IPS Threat Level Action High - DROP or BLOCK
custom_item_52.info: Verify IPS items classified as threat level 'high' are set to DROP or BLOCK.
custom_item_52.solution: In the Web UI , navigate to the 'Subscription Services' section , click on 'IPS', click the 'Settings' button and then click the drop down box for Threat level 'High' -> 'Action' to 'Drop' or 'Block'.

custom_item_53.description: WatchGuard : IPS Threat Level Action Medium - DROP or BLOCK
custom_item_53.info: Verify IPS items classified as threat level 'medium' are set to DROP or BLOCK.
custom_item_53.solution: In the Web UI , navigate to the 'Subscription Services' section , click on 'IPS', click the 'Settings' button and then click the drop down box for Threat level 'Medium' -> 'Action' to 'Drop' or 'Block'.
